sentence: In 1994, Johnson founded Perry Johnson Registrars, a Troy-based company that audits and certifies other firms as meeting international standards for quality management systems.
author: Paul Egan
title: 'Quality guru' Perry Johnson joins crowded Republican race for Michigan governor

sentence: Trailing Craig and Soldano were several other candidates in the packed primary race, including businessman Perry Johnson at eight percent, real estate broker and activist Ryan Kelly at six percent, conservative commentator Tudor Dixon at three percent, and former car dealership owner Kevin Rinke at two percent, according to the poll.
author: Ashley Oliver
title: Poll: Former Detroit Police Chief James Craig Holds Double-Digit Lead in Michigan Governor's Primary

sentence: The August primary also includes two wealthy businessmen, Kevin Rinke and Perry Johnson.

sentence: Governors ? MI-Gov: Republican Rep. Jack Bergman, whose 1st District covers the Upper Peninsula and northernmost portion of the Lower Peninsula, has switched his endorsement in the August GOP primary from former Detroit Police Chief James Craig to self-funding businessman Perry Johnson.

sentence: Craig is the current frontrunner in the Republican primary, but the primary field is packed with other candidates, including chiropractor Garrett Soldano, businessman Perry Johnson, real estate broker and activist Ryan Kelley, conservative commentator Tudor Dixon, and former car dealership owner Kevin Rinke.

title: Poll: Michigan Democrat Gretchen Whitmer Trails Republican on Generic Ballot for Governor's Race

sentence: The reports also say that Oakland County businessman and "quality guru" Perry Johnson did not file enough valid signatures, but they clear Norton Shores businesswoman Tudor Dixon, whose petitions were also the subject of a complaint.

title: State elections report: James Craig and Perry Johnson filed too few signatures for ballot
